intro: Licaria nayaritensis, commonly known as the Nayarit licaria, is a flowering plant species native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
